wikipedia_page.main: William Savage Newton (1878 – 6 January 1915) was a British sports shooter. He competed in the 50 yard free pistol event at the 1908 Summer Olympics.Born in Montreal, Canada, he served during World War I as a Captain in the Honourable Artillery Company. He was killed in action in Belgium during World War I, recordedly aged 36. He was buried in Kemmel Chateau Military Cemetery.
